This may have over-all relevance for PR in this project:
Locally people say when they hear: "McLuhan must have
been right about media all along,w
Same pattern might be workable elsewhere.
Now the Edgar Dales are simply working on media content.
They have never faced media as media. How can we scare
them into an experimental effort and critical examination
of their own assumptions? Does he know the Transactional
School of psychologists? Could we get somebody to write
a letter of inquiry to his New3 Letter asking whether
Arnheim, Ames, Piaget, Contril, and Ittelson types of
approach would be more valid for media study than fee
content analysis? That is, the configurational rather
than the fragmentary.
I have written to Foshay, Max Goldberg, and. others asking
this question. I am now working on the structural linguists
for the same information about media as languages. They
will be helpful.
Let*s not be scared, Harry! But what we are talking about
here is a far jigger and more radical change than Dewey ever
thought of. But events are even more with us than they
were with him. So it will go. We will win.
Let*s keep in mind that general theory isthe dynamic or live
model./that produces all the mechanical test models; e.g.,Dewey* s
"learning by doing". "Medium isthe message" is just as
radical and reveals the subliminal structures in learning
and ability at a glance. Associated with this dynamic model
is the factor of learning saturation via ads, radio, movie,
TV by the age of three or four, as with mother tongue.
Saturation creates subliminal backlog steadily, just as we
go dead on all the live metaphor in our language very quickly.
To switch £ moment. It should be easy to collect data from
technicians about the changing problems of relating sound to
image in (a) talkies vs old silent pix; (b)TV vs talkie;
re Girrard would help here.
It is by division of labor that pre-literate man moves
towards the dissociation of his senses,which leads to
